Params: {1: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiStoryZhengyanNew.prefab', 2: '3'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory41.jpg'}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: 'Commandant...'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Celica', 3: 'Mr. President, Lucia is awake.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'A long, long nightmare. A nightmare where Commandant is nowhere to be found.'}
{3: 'An attempt to sit up—only to find the operating system for the limbs disconnected.'}
{3: 'Mouth... opening to call out for a certain someone.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Hassen', 3: "You're awake, Lucia?", 4: '2'}
{3: '"President Hassen, are we in Babylonia, or somewhere else?" Words. Lips. Mouth moving, or not? Sound does not come out.'}
{2: 'Hassen', 3: 'I know you have a lot of questions, but right now, you need to rest.', 4: '2'}
{3: "The president's words jog my memories. It was a loss against Alpha, again."}
{3: '—Losing to myself.'}
{3: "It wasn't enough. It ended in failure. I wanted to show Commandant. I wanted Commandant to be proud. But, I lost again."}
{3: "In the end, when I was lying in Commandant's arms, I tried to smile, so that Commandant wouldn't be as worried about me."}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: "Where's... C-Commandant?"}
{2: 'Hassen', 3: 'I sent Gray Raven to join the resistance against Gabriel. I had Ayla bring a comms device with them, but then at some point we lost connection.', 4: '2'}
{3: "That doesn't sound good. I need to get to Commandant as soon as possible."}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: 'Agh... Argh!'}
{3: "I need to be there for everyone... be there for Commandant. Something tells me that I'll regret it if I don't. I mobilize every working part of my body and crawl out of the bed."}
{2: 'Hassen', 3: 'Hold on, what are you doing?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: 'Send me to battle...'}
{2: 'Hassen', 3: "You're too damaged. Let the others do the fighting.", 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Asimov', 3: 'If she wants to fight, let her. We brought a spare frame, remember?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Hassen', 3: 'That frame is still being configured. And you know full well what letting Lucia use that frame would mean.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: "A frame containing Alpha's data can never be fully configured. Initialization is required before it can be used, no matter the case.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'I don\'t understand what they\'re talking about, but the word "frame" stands out for me.'}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: 'Whatever works. Let me use it.'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'Lucia, we developed a new frame for you. Built on all the data Gray Raven has gained so far.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: "As in what we've been through...?"}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: "You can say that, but your experiences alone aren't enough. If you've realized that you are a replica, then you know how powerful the original Lucia is.", 4: '1'}
{3: "I know. That's why I don't want to lose."}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: "That's why I tuned up this frame with data from Alpha. Unedited. The entire set.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: "That's... what the initialization is for?"}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'Yes. The frame is data-overloaded. So if you want to use it, your thought model will have to be reconfigured through initialization.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: "We don't know what will become of you after the initialization. More Lucia, more Alpha, or someone completely different? No one can tell.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: "Even if it all works out and you're back in operation, you will longer be yourself.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: "Constructs can acquire memories by loading themselves with data. But you will only be reading these memories, not living them. They will always be someone else's.", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Hassen', 3: "Asimov, this is too much... And even if we activate that frame, there's still no way of getting her back in battle, right?", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'We do have a decommissioned single-person aircraft left. Still functional enough to take her to Kowloong.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'I just caught a signal from Gray Raven... They might be in danger.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'Your frame, Lucia. Your call.', 4: '1'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory0.png'}
{3: "Using this frame is tantamount to suicide—it will kill Lucia, this current Lucia. That's what Asimov is implying."}
{3: "That's a small price to pay, much smaller than I expected. Everyone has a grim look on their face, and yet I can't help smiling."}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: 'Wait for me, Commandant.'}
